task.title: Create a Geofence
task.shortdesc: The Time feature provides administrators with the tools needed to create and manage geofences. A geofence is an area around a geographic location in which assigned employees punch in and out on their mobile devices. Also, administrators can track and manage activity around and within those fences.

step.cmd: Enter a recognizable name for the geofence.
If applicable, enter a description, location, and start and end dates.
Hover over the Layers icon in the top right corner, and then select to view the map by either Streets or Imagery.
Select the Search (magnifying glass) icon if you want to enter a specific address.
Select the shape to draw the map: a polygon, which gives you more control so you can specify different points, or a circle.

info.note: Since there are many variables and GPS coordinates are not precise, it is recommended that a margin of error be included within the fence.

step.cmd: To remove an unsaved fence, select the trash can and then click on the shape you drew. Select Apply.

step.info: The Geofences page (Time > Settings > Geofences) enables you to view information in a list or map. In the list view, you can apply filters (for example, view Active, Inactive, or All geofences). You can also search for a geofence by entering it in the Name field. The map view enables you to zoom to view a selected geofence.

info.note: A geofence can be deleted if it is not currently in any geofence group and if punch data has not been associated with it. To delete or edit a geofence, select the appropriate option from the Actions column on the Geofences page.
